news.title: In Strategy Shift, Facebook Seeks to Pay Millions to License News
news.description: Facebook has reportedly approached a number of prominent news outlets with a proposal to license their content on its platform in a new initiative that could begin as early as this year.

news.description: Amazon has come under scrutiny once again for utilizing Twitter ambassadors in an apparent effort to improve public perception of the working conditions at its fulfillment centers.

news.title: YouTube Sues Alleged Copyright Troll Over Extortion of Multiple YouTubers
news.description: YouTube has accused an individual of utilizing false copyright strikes to extort money from numerous YouTube creators, and has brought suit under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act.

news.title: Facebook Rolls Out Tool to Block Off-Facebook Data Tracking
news.description: In an apparent effort to preempt regulation in the US and abroad, Facebook is testing a new tool that will limit how the social media platform can track user behavior outside of Facebook.
